items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: This message has been issued because some minor flooding to riverside roads and footpaths is possible through this afternoon and evening, Saturday 27th November. Water levels are likely to remain higher than usual for the next few days. This is due to weather conditions associated with Storm Arwen. High tidal water moving up the rivers from Great Yarmouth is currently restricting the normal drainage of the Broads river system out to sea at low tide. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. Take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. We are monitoring the situation and not expecting the situation to escalate. We will update this message by 10:00am tomorrow, Sunday 28th November.

This flood alert remains in force due to strong northerly winds associated with Storm Arwen causing large waves and spray overtopping along the North Yorkshire Coast during Saturday 27th November until 16:00. Hazardous conditions remain throughout the weekend. The particular areas at risk are exposed areas of the coast around the North Sea coast from Bridlington to Barmston. Please be careful along beaches, coastal footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated by 20:00 on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

The flood alert for the River Rye and tributaries has been issued. River levels have risen as a result of rainfall overnight on Friday 26th November 2021.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected during Saturday 27th November 2021. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses, and do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 20:00 on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

items.description: Upper Avon River Swift and Clay Coton Brook
items.message:
River levels have risen at the Clay Coton river gauge as a result of heavy rainfall.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible today Saturday 27/11/21. Flooding could affect low-lying land and roads adjacent to River Avon between Stanford and Rugby, River Swift between Cosford and Rugby and Clay Coton Brook between Yelvertoft and Lilbourne. There is no further rainfall expected today.  
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.  
This message will be updated tomorrow Sunday 28/11/21 or as the situation changes.

Tides along the River Esk estuary are expected to be high as a result of the effects from Storm Arwen and rainfall overnight on the Esk catchment during   Saturday 27th November between 08:30 and 13:30. Areas most at risk include Low lying land in the Esk Valley, particularly around Briggswath, Ruswarp and some minor roads. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. You can check flood warnings and alerts on the GOV.UK website or via Floodline number 0345 988 1188. We are monitoring the situation closely. This message will be updated by noon on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

The flood alert for the River Seven catchment has been issued. River levels have risen in this area as a result of rainfall overnight on Friday 26th November 2021. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected during Saturday 27th November 2021. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. You can check flood warnings and alerts on the GOV.UK website or via Floodline number 0345 988 1188. We are monitoring the situation closely. This message will be updated by noon on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

The flood alert for the River Riccal catchment has been issued. River levels have risen rapidly in this area as a result of heavy rainfall overnight on Friday 26th November 2021. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected during Saturday 27th November 2021 during the afternoon and evening. Areas most at risk are low lying land and roads. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated Saturday by 17:00 on 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

Flood warning issued due to strong northerly winds associated with Storm Arwen expected to cause large waves and spray overtopping along the North Yorkshire Coast tomorrow morning, Saturday 27th November between 07:30 and 14:30. Hazardous conditions might extend 2 hours either side of the high tide. Areas most at risk are properties at Sandside, where localised flooding may occur due to overtopping and spray. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous with debris. You can check flood warnings and alerts on the GOV.UK website or via Floodline number 0345 988 1188. We are monitoring the situation closely. This message will be updated by noon on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

Large and powerful waves are expected to continue to overtop sea defences as a result of Storm Arwen along the Northumberland Coast. Strong waves and spray are expected throughout the morning and into this afternoon, 27/11/2021. Areas most at risk are beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please be careful along beaches, promenades, coastal footpaths and roads as large waves and sea spray could be dangerous.  

This message will be updated by 19:00 tonight, 27/11/2021, or as the situation changes.

Please be careful along beaches, coastal footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This message will be updated by 20:00 on Saturday 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.

The particular areas at risk are exposed areas of the coast around Scarborough, particularly low lying paths around Scarborough North Bay promenade. Please be careful along beaches, coastal footpaths and roads in the area, as large waves and sea spray can be dangerous with debris. We will continue to monitor the forecast and levels closely. This flood warning has been issued due to heavy rainfall overnight on Friday 26th November 2021. River levels on the River Seven are rising and are expected to peak at Normanby between 12:30 and 16:00 on Saturday 27th November 2021. The areas particularly at risk are properties along Marton Road. Our incident response staff are closely monitoring the forecast. Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and do not walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated on Saturday evening before 21:00 on 27th November 2021, or as the situation changes.
